results.title: The Entertainer
results.creator_credit: Donald Wrye, Beryl Vertue, Marvin Hamlisch, Persky-Bright Productions and Robert Stigwood Organisation
results.brief_description: Coping with constant failures, down and almost out comedian Archie Rice (jack Lemmon) lives with his family and his famous retired father Billy (Ray Bolger). He dreams of the day he will be a star. Cast also includes Sada thompson, Tyne Daly, Michael Cristofer. From the play by John Osborne with music by Marvin Hamlisch.

results.title: The Enemy within (2003) [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Eva Colmers, Bonnie Thompson, Jerry Krepakevich and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: In World War II thousands of German prisoners-of-war were sent to camps in Canada where they saw out the war, many for several years. This documentary examines the experiences of a few of those men, as well as presenting the perspectives of the Canadian guards. Filmmaker Eva Colmers (a German-born resident of Canada) focuses on the story of her father - a POW who has fond memories of his time in captivity. If this seems disingenuous, it is through a series of interviews that he reveals that he was well fed, well treated and educated during his confinement. Of interest here is also the workings of a POW camp — how the men strictly adhered to their rank and values as soldiers, even remaining loyal to Hitler. What is clear is that they were treated with respect that fostered loyalty, to the point where the prisoners were released to work on farms, and as lumberjacks, and were even allowed at times, to wander beyond the barbwire. Overall this is a fascinating tale that mixes interviews with archival footage, thus presenting a very humanistic slant on what was a cruel and murderous time in history.

results.title: The End of the game
results.creator_credit: Robin Lehman, Claire Wilbur and Opus Films
results.brief_description: In the African dawn, thunderclouds gather, welcomed by croaking frogs in the marshes. Monkeys swing on trees, lion cubs pull one another’s tails and the gnu, antelope and giraffe suckle their young. The animals of the savanna hunt and play. The sound of a rifle shatters the magic. Animals disappear - one by one - in a dramatic climax that makes a poignant plea for conservation. Filmed, without spoken commentary, by Robin Lehman in Kenya, Tanzania and Zaire.

results.title: The Enchanted Cottage
results.creator_credit: John Cromwell, Harriet Parsons and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: A disfigured World War II veteran marries a decidedly plain girl and they seclude themselves inside a small New England cottage. A small miracle occurs when they are transformed into a handsome couple, as they see each other through the eyes of love. Based on the play by Sir Arthur Wing Pinero, this fable proves that beauty is in the eye of the beholder. Starring Dorothy McGuire and Robert Young.

results.title: The English patient (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Anthony Minghella, Saul Zaentz and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: Based on Michael Ondaatje’s Booker prize-winning novel, “The English Patient” is a sumptuous romance set during the second world war in the deserts of North Africa and the rolling hills of Tuscany. Hana (Juliette Binoche), a shell-shocked Canadian nurse decides to stay in an abandoned villa to nurse a mysterious English patient (Ralph Fiennes) who is burned beyond recognition and doesn’t remember his name. Gradually we learn the truth of his identity and of his doomed love affair with Katherine Mansfield (Kristen Scott Thomas). Winner of 9 Oscars at the 1996 Academy Awards, including Best Film, Best Director, Best Supporting Actress (Juliette Binoche) and Best Cinematography for Australian John Seale.

results.title: The End of the rainbow = Das Lockende ziel
results.creator_credit: Max Reichmann, British Empire Films and Richard Tauber Tonfilm-Prod. GmbH
results.brief_description: A Bavarian love story featuring world renowned tenor Richard Tauber in the lead role with Sophie Pagay, Lucie Englisch, Oscar Sima, Karl Elzer, Marie Elsmer. Written by Walter Forster and Paul Horbiger. In German with occasional English captions.

results.title: The Empire strikes back
results.creator_credit: Irvin Kershner, Gary Kurtz and Lucasfilm, Ltd.
results.brief_description: The second of the “Star wars trilogy” is a blacker film than the previous “Star Wars.” The Rebel Alliance, defeated by the Empire on the ice planet of Hoth, must seek refuge elsewhere in order to re-group. Luke Skywalker goes to the planet of Dagobah to complete his training with the Jedi Master, Yoda. Hans, Leia and Chewbacca escape, but the evil reach of the Empire means that a confrontation between good and evil is inevitable. Luke as a fledgling Jedi, must face Darth Vader, who uses a terrible secret and the power of the Dark Side of the Force, to lure Luke to destruction. Includes a ten minute interview between Leonard Maltin and George Lucas.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Irvin Kershner, Gary Kurtz and Lucasfilm, Ltd.

results.title: The Emperor and the nightingale
results.creator_credit: Mark Sottnick, Joel Tuber, Rabbit Ears Productions and Windham Hill
results.brief_description: Glenn Close narrates Hans Christian Andersen’s story of the Chinese emperor who discovers that the song of a free nightingale, is more beautiful and more valuable by far, than the finest and cleverest, bejewelled mechanical singing bird. The exquisite illustrations are by Robert Van Nutt and the evocative music is by Mark Isham.

results.title: The Electric grandmother
results.creator_credit: Noel Black, Doro Bachrach and Highgate Pictures
results.brief_description: An adaptation of the Ray Bradbury story “I Sing the Body Electric”. A young family who lose their mother through death are subsequently delivered an electric ‘grandmother’ who seeks to provide for all their needs, both emotional and physical. This film provides an insight inside into child versus adult perceptions of growth, ageing, human relationships and man’s motivation for creating machines
